meanings.sent1: Taking an umbrella can obviate getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a seatbelt can obviate serious injuries in a car accident.
meanings.sent3: Carrying an extra pen can obviate the need to borrow one from others.
meanings.sent4: A good night's sleep can obviate the need for caffeine in the morning.
meanings.sent5: Regular exercise can obviate health issues later in life.

meanings.definition: To make unnecessary by taking action in advance
meanings.sent1: Planning your route can obviate the need for a GPS.
meanings.sent2: Studying ahead of time can obviate the stress of last-minute cramming.
meanings.sent3: Buying in bulk can obviate frequent trips to the store.
meanings.sent4: A well-insulated house can obviate the need for constant heating.
meanings.sent5: Proper maintenance can obviate costly repairs in the future.
